snippet: To signal he has not given up on unifying the country, the president visited two of the nation’s most Republican states: Idaho and Kansas.
abstract: Pres Obama, in wake of State of the Union address, visits Idaho and Kansas, two of country's most Republican states; mindful of his legacy and persistent in efforts to unify nation, he speaks to college students in Boise on first visit to Idaho since he was elected president.
lead_paragraph: To signal he has not given up on unifying the country, the president visited two of the nation’s most Republican states: Idaho and Kansas.

headline.main: For Encore, Obama Takes His ‘One America’ Tour to Idaho and Kansas
headline.print_headline: For Encore, Obama Takes His ‘One America’ Tour to Idaho and Kansas
